ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great survey of the issues relating to global health. The best way to gain exposure to the subject matter if you feel that you lack knowledge in this area.
Yes. However, the work is very back heavy, and there is not a lot of room for discussion.

This course was an excellent way to look at global health from the perspective of many different disciplines, and the speakers are amazing. Just for the chance to get to interact and talk with these people one on one I would recommend it to another student.
Yes: Good lectures, renowned guests, very worthwhileNo: General structure is "missing"

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I am an undergraduate so I have no dissertation, but the course was an excellent way to look at global health from the perspective of many different disciplines I had not yet been exposed to, and in that way deepened my knowledge of the field.
Provided a broaders perspective of specific poverty realted issues.
More knowledge about current issues in the field of global health
Gave me great insights on the mind of public health/global health leaders. For the good and the bad.
